description.narrative: The Pan-American Development Foundation (PADF/FUPAD) i Colombia har ansökt om finansiering från Sida om 4 800 000 SEK för perioden 2017–2020. Insatsen övergripande mål är att stödja offentlig antikorruptionspolitik, medborgerlig delaktighet och ansvarsutkrävande för att förbättra offentlig förvaltning, samhällsservice och transparens. Insatsen har tre specifika mål: 1) Främja medborgarnas deltagande genom att stärka människors kunskap och förmåga att bekämpa korruption. 2) Stärka offentliga institutioner så att de införlivar förfaranden som främjar administrativ effektivitet, bästa praxis och transparens, och 3) Främja förtroendeskapande och transparanta processer genom att underlätta dialogen mellan medborgare och offentligt anställda.

The Pan-American Development Foundation (PADF/FUPAD) in Colombia has applied to Sida for funding of 4 800 000 SEK during the period 2017-2020. The overall objective of the intervention is to promote anti-corruption policies, citizen participation and accountability to improve public management, service delivery and transparency. The intervention has three specific objectives: 1. Promoting citizen participation by strengthening people’s knowledge and capabilities to fight against corruption; 2. Strengthening public institutions to incorporate procedures that promote administrative efficiency, best practices and transparency; and 3. Fostering trust-building and transparency processes, by facilitating dialogue between citizens and public servants.

tag.narrative: 16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

description.narrative: In the period 2017-2018, the Fund supported three initiatives implemented by Foros Semana and Transparencia por Colombia. During 2019, Fupad focused on the formulation and operation of one project that addresses the three objectives of the Fund: “Protect peace-building in sectors and regions with high corruption risks”, implemented by Transparencia por Colombia (chapter of Transparency International) and two local partner organizations in Cauca (Foro Nacional por Colombia Capítulo Suroccidente) and Caquetá (Fundación Red Desarrollo y Paz de Caquetá). This project promotes accountability and citizen participation in mechanisms stablished by the Peace Agreement -such as PDETs, PICs and PNIS- at the national and local levels. The initiative encourages whistleblowing and citizen complaints to fight corruption, by providing legal support and conducting outreach campaigns from the Center for Legal Advice on Anti-corruption -ALAC. Project operation started on September 2019; therefore, results correspond to the first four months of implementation consisting mainly of preparation actions: - Organizational set up among Transparencia por Colombia and local implementing partners, including developing shared methodologies and identifying potential beneficiaries for conducting field work. - Two policy documents were produced to inform new local authorities on corruption risks in the implementation of Peace Agreement’s mechanisms in their territories and provide recommendations on strategies to mitigate them, to be included in local development plans. In addition, meetings were held with national institutions responsible for the implementation of PICs to address corruption risks. - A draft on characterization of citizens’ corruption complaints and whistleblower protection at the national level was prepared, including policy recommendations to State authorities on how to strengthen complaints mechanisms.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
